required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of CD276 Targeted Autologous Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell Infusion in Patients With CD276 Positive Advanced Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of CD276 Targeted Autologous Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell Infusion in Patients With CD276 Positive Advanced Solid Tumor

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

brief_summary.textblock: Cd276 (B7-H3) is an ideal target for car-t treatment because of its high expression on the surface of neuroblastoma, osteosarcoma, gastric cancer and lung cancer cells, but not in normal peripheral cells or tissues. In conclusion, car-t cell therapy has achieved exciting results in blood tumors, but it has been stopped in solid tumor. The main reason for the poor effect is the existence of tumor microenvironment of solid tumor, which inhibits the chemotaxis and infiltration of car-t cells to tumor site. Therefore, in this clinical experiment, we will explore the best model of car-t therapy for solid tumor by intravenous and local tumor injection, which will bring new hope to patients with osteosarcoma, neuroblastoma and gastric cancer

primary_outcome.description: The highest concentration of CAR-T cells in peripheral blood after infusion

arm_group.arm_group_label: T cell injection targeting CD276 chimeric antigen receptor

intervention.description: Targeting CD276 autologous chimeric antigen receptor T cells
intervention.arm_group_label: T cell injection targeting CD276 chimeric antigen receptor
